Reviews.Title: “Great Location (:”
Reviews.Author: Cindy L
Reviews.Content: Value-for-money because of its great location (near Madeline Station and shopping area) Room is clean and proper. Went for their morning breakfast, EUR 13, I would say it was slightly expensive for me, but with the overall selection, it is still by far the most wholesome hotel breakfast i have ever eaten. (cereals, different ham selection, bread, milk, eggs, etc) There are lots of small restaurants/shophouses near the hotel. The French restaurant just beside the hotel is really good, with friendly staff which speaks perfect english, and the other restaurant at the far left corner of the hotel is always crowded during lunch time, so I reckoned their food and services should be good too.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous little hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Lillie82
Reviews.Content: As a first time visitor to Paris, I trawled through trip advisor reviews looking at all sorts of hotels. This little gem cropped up a few times and I was drawn to it. So we decided to book it for our 3 day stay. The location is fantastic. We hopped on the Roissy bus from terminal 2D at Charles De Gaull direct to Rue Auber/ Rue Scribe, right opposite the Ballet school ( around an hour journey traffic permitting). The hotel is a stones throw from here. On entering the hotel, we were greeted by a friendly member of staff, and everything ran smoothly. Our room was on 4th floor, and as previous review mentioned quite small, but very charming and cozy. We loved it! There are plenty little restaurnants close by and walking around you will see some lovely little streets and lights at night. On walking down Rue Tronchet just before turning right onto Rue Castellane, you will see L'Église de la Madeleine at the end of the street, which is a beatiful buillding. We used the Open tour bus to discover the city and thought that it was excellent value. You can get on the bus at Rue Aber, again very close to our hotel. The breakfast room was spectacular and the continental breakfast was amazing. Great selection, and lovely fresh food. Started our days perfect. All in all, a great hotel, great location and very nice area. I would definatley reccommend this place to a friend, and will be back in the future without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo_Parkinson
Reviews.Content: We've stayed one week here. Nice place, clean (but small) room and bathroom. Silent street, close to Subway, Madeleine and Galeries Lafayette. Good continental breakfast. Helpfull staff (though one guy didn´t know there is a bakery across the street). Check messages by the reception when you arrive from the street, because sometimes they forget to warn you.

Reviews.Title: “Best Tango in Paris”
Reviews.Author: utya
Reviews.Content: Great accomodation in Paris, close to the Opera, Galleries Lafayette, Princetemps etc, Metro stations handy (as always), good cafes about. Room moderately sized with double bed and modern fitout, a nice bathroom. As expected no Tea Coffee facilities but a small bar in reception which serves drinks and coffee.. Good free Wifi access in room. A continental breakfast is served in a large room in the basement with good range. Very clean, well presented. Very helpful staff, friendly and communicative. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of the Right Bank”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWoodlands
Reviews.Content: We just completed our 5th stay at the Folkestone Opera, a moderately priced hotel between the Place de la Madeleine and Blvd Haussmann, on a quiet side street. We keep coming back because the location is central to most of what we do in Paris, plus a 2 minute walk from main Metro lines, RER and train station. Selection of restaurants in the area runs the gamut from fast-food/take-away to haute cuisine plus Lafayette Gourrmet grocery. Laetitia and Virginie are unfailingly cordial and helpful, plus speak fluent English and other languages to assist guests who do not speak French. The already sumptuous breakfast buffet has been expanded since our visit in 2010, while keeping the scrumptious mini-croissants and mini-pains-au-chocolat. Wifi is free and there's also a computer and printer available in the lobby. We'll keep coming back to this comfortable spot in the heart of Paris, our home-away-from home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gopagi
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for huge rooms (although in this lovely city it is rare to find the larger rooms expected by some Americans) look elsewhere. Otherwise, this small hotel is absolutely perfect. At least it was perfect for my elderly mother, my husband and me. We would love to stay there again. The hotel is clean, and the rooms well-appointed with all the basics and some luxuries, such as a flat screen TV, and black out curtains for jet-lagged sleeping, which made our stay everything we could have asked for. The single room for my mother was very comfortable for one person, and the double room for my husband and me had a quite a bit more floor space, as well as room for a sofa and chair with small table. We did not feel cramped at all. The location is near enough to Gare St. Lazare that we were easily able to walk to the train station with our luggage and with one of us in a wheelchair. There are a numerous shops, restaurants, and great people watching within steps of the hotel, as well as nearby taxis, metros, bus and hop-on-hop-off stops and numerous historic sites. Breakfast in the hotel is far more than adequate, including croissants, fruit, cereal, cheese, meats, yogurt, among other choices. The staff (we mostly saw and dealt with Virginie) is wonderful: knowledgeable, helpful, courteous, and very patient! Next time, we would stay there longer, since it's a great base from which to cruise Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Danvilera
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good located, 2 blocks from the Madelaine, walking distance from Galerie Lafayette and a nice shopping street. Free wifi, breakfast not included. A lot of restaurants near the hotel. Great value for the price in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: osirees
Reviews.Content: Its a small hotel in very good location. If 30 min walk is in your comfort zone then you can find Opera, Lafayette market, Louvre, Concord, Champs-Elysees, Jardin within your range. The rooms are compact, but that's how most of the rooms are in Paris. The room service was good. They even had a free shaving kit and that was big plus for me. There is a shop next to the hotel which open till midnight. So just in case you need something to munch or a beer or wine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for shopping, near metro for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Christi1101
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby, good breakfast included with room, easy to navigate around by walking and metro once we got accustomed to our surroundings. Rooms were small-ish, but about average for what we saw in Paris, bedding and bath were nice and clean. A/C worked great, but elevator did not one day, although thankfully it was fixed quickly by that evening, as the walk up 5 flights of narrow stairs was strenuous. Desk staff friendly and helpful. My parents had a room on 6th floor with balcony - nice balcony but their room and bathroom was smaller than the one my daughter and I shared for less $$. Our only complaint was that hotel could not hold our bags for more than 24 hours (we needed 2 days) while we were in Normandy region - fortunately the first hotel we stayed in Paris that WE HAD CHECKED OUT OF ALREADY agreed to hold them for us and saved the day. Not sure what we would've done...

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: DoAsTheLocalsDo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Folkestone Opera because the hotel we initially booked was overbooked and so we were transferred. All in all the Folkestone Opera is a great base to explore Paris. Pros: * spacious, clean rooms * good location (around the corner of Madeleine church) * from here, you can reach most attractions on foot * nice decor * close to shopping, restaurants and sights * friendly, helpful staff Cons: * no parking (but hey, it's Paris :)) * breakfast not included * architecture is not as charming as it looks on website/in brochures (maybe the more expensive rooms are)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: katrin3112
Reviews.Content: The hotel is idealy located right in the center of Paris. Most attractions can be reached by foot - the metro station Madeleine is right around a corner from the hotel and from there any place in Paris is within easy reach. The roomes are small but that is Paris standard - only the bathroom was a little to small for our liking. If you travel with a lot of luggage consider renting a supirior room because they are bigger. The rooms and hallways are very clean and neat. There wasn't a speck of dust around and the bedding smelled fresh not stale like in some hotels. A really big positiv surprise was the breakfast - it's really really good for a french hotel. The service is exellent, nothing ever ran out and the lady was very sweet and helpful. You get a good variety of breakfast possibilities for every tast. You can even boil your eggs just the way you like them. We didn't expect a breakfast this good at a 3 star hotel in Paris. We really recommend this hotel and will stay here again on our next stay. Of all the four hotels we tried in Paris, this has been the best so far.

Reviews.Title: “Unobjectionable”
Reviews.Author: cajmere
Reviews.Content: Agree with most of the reviews that this small hotel is a fairly safe bet for both short business and leisure stays in central Paris. Prices are fair I would think given the location and the ability to earn points/miles, etc. Check-in was efficient (although some things could have been better explained to me. Check-out was better and I was able to check out a couple hours later than normal which helped a lot. The rooms are small, but you expect that for central Paris. The decor could use a bit of a refreshener, it seemed slightly on the stodgy side and not modern, but was very pleased with the bathroom which was in great condition including a tub, and their own brand of toiletries provided were acceptable. Lobby has a computer and printer for guests and made use of that on several occasions. Breakfast was a bit disappointing. Quality of items was okay but the service a bit lacking and the variety of some items like fresh fruit, cereals, eggs. If you are used to a very continental style breafast then it's fine. I wouldn't exactly call it a "romantic" place to stay in Paris, but it didn't seem to be a tourist trap either. Mostly couples and older travelers, a generally quiet and respectable place, not the place to be if you want a bar scene or to mingle with other travelers...Worked fine for business although the wifi stopped working one day and was not rectified which did create some hassles for me. An easy stroll to all the grand magsins, the Madeleine, etc. etc. so great if you need to do business but want to get away for quick shopping spree...

Reviews.Title: “Geat location”
Reviews.Author: pietermaritzburg3201
Reviews.Content: I would like to say that is hotel is in a perfect location for all attractions. The rooms are small, but the staff where great. The area is very upmarket so nothing is cheap near the hotel, but I would stay there again. try and book a hotel room with a balcony, we had the back room, view of a brick wall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ATantawy
Reviews.Content: I spent 7 nights in this hotel with my wife and 1 year old daughter and we loved the place. I requested a room with 2 single beds were I can push them together and get a slightly bigger bed than a double bed (I thought so) so my daughter can share it with us. On my arrival they told me that the room I requested is ready and they've prepared another room that they recommend as it has more space to accommodate a baby crib (which they provided). I ended up staying in the room they recommended with the same rate. Room was very clean and in a very good shape, size of the room was OK but I think this is the case everywhere in Paris. Elevator was a bit small but enough to take the 3 of us and a folded stroller. Location of the hotel is great. 5 minutes walk to both Madeline & Hauvre-Caumartin metro stations which almost makes the whole city accessible. The area was very nice, busy in the morning and quite at night which allowed for a very good sleep. Very good location for shopping, the whole area is full of shops and very close to Printemps & Lafayette. There is a small grocery shop in the next building which stays up late (until 11PM). The area has a couple of nice restaurants. Specially a pizzeria at the end of the street to the left which the hotel staff recommended and turned out to be great. I would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: btgm
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed here. The last time was June 2009, and I posted a review then too. This time it was just my 12 year old daughter and me. We arrived at Gare St Lazare from Bayeux and left the next day for CDG airport using the Roissy bus. It was about a 15 min walk to each. The hotel is very nice, with more character than you would expect from a Best Western but less than at a B&B, where we usually prefer to stay. The rooms were quite clean, and the elevator was working fine. We arrived about 10AM, checked in, and left our bags. We returned after dinner to be assigned our room. The room had 2 twin beds and not a lot of other space, we basically sat or lay on the beds and our 2 22 in roller suitcases took up most of the free floor space, although we could still walk around them. There are blackout blinds on the windows which worked fine (automatic metal things). We had the breakfast included in our rate as I didn't want to deal with finding breakfast before we left for the airport. It was adequate, a buffet with breads, cold cuts, tea/coffee, yogurt, and a place to make soft boiled (I guess you could make hard boiled too) eggs, which we didn't use. I think it is 15€ if it's not included, which is pricey. If staying longer, I would just find a bakery. Someone on the Paris forum listed some nearby for me, but we didn't go looking. There are quite a few restaurants in walking distance, but many of them seemed to be closed on Sun. (We stayed on Sun night.) I think if staying longer I might want someplace with more character and larger rooms, but this was excellent for our 1 night stay, and I would stay there again. Very convenient for arrival at St Lazare and departing by Roissybus. There are several metro stations within a 10 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfy & quiet for Paris”
Reviews.Author: ivan12328
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights with husband, 2 teenagers, and my parents. Our request to have adjacent rooms was honored. The hotel is so small that you really need only be on the same floor and you will be close to everyone else on that floor (important to us as we we were traveling together and with teenagers.) Rooms and beds are very small, but that seems to be the norm for Paris. All our rooms were are on the 4th floor (404, 406, and 408) and faced the courtyard, which is just a driveway and parking area, so we had no view of anything, but it was very quiet. With the AC on at night it was very quiet. Extra pillows and a fan were available when I asked for them. Breakfast was awesome and well worth the price (relative to Paris prices.) There is no in room coffee which I guess is also typical Paris. The free wi-fi worked well. They did provide washcloths. The elevator was small and dangerous to slow-moving people, but it was functional during our entire stay. The in-room safe requires a 50 euro cash deposit and does not work by combination, but by key. It did not fit our 15inch HP laptop. There is a computer and printer for use in the lobby. The location is great, convenient to everything, but on a very quiet street. There seemed to be a good percentage of business travelers there. The staff was nice and all spoke English. The price was decent for that part of Paris. They did try to say I made a phone call I didn't make, which was particularlly odd because it happened to us a week later in London too. Not sure what's up with that, but when I was firm that we did not make any outside calls, the staff did not press the issue and we did not pay. Overall, great base for exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: alpha26
Reviews.Content: Great location for tourists: near metro stop, gare St. Lazare, Champs, restaurants....even a small grocery store next door. Friendly, multi-lingual staff (esp. Virginie). Nice breakfast. Room small, but clean, quiet and comfortable; good A/C.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: jlukea
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok, the location is good and the room we had was clean and tidy. The rooms are small though so for an extended stay we would probably go elsewhere. The air-con was working but not very well, so we had a few hot nights. No real views from the windows. The staff were helpful and spoke English well enough for us to ask questions. Would stay somewhere else next time, but not an unhappy experience.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Hotel and Room in 8th Arrondisement”
Reviews.Author: Pennsylvania1
Reviews.Content: We were there the first week of March, 2010 for 7 nights. This is the 6th time we have stayed within a two block radius of this location but the first time at the Folkestone. This was our 10th visit to Paris. The 8th Arrondissement close to the Madeleine Church is very central in terms of transportation and sightseeing. The hotel is one block to the Madeleine Metro station and the Number 42 bus route which goes to/from Gare du Nord and to the Eiffel Tower. It is 3 blocks to the Auber RER station which is handy for getting to/from CDG airport (30 minutes) and Euro Disney (40 minutes). It is a 10 minute walk to Gare St. Lazare and 5 minutes to the major department stores on Boulevard Haussmann. There is a small grocery store on the street and a very good bakery across the street (the hotel gets it's bread and pastries from there). There are a number of restaurants in the area and the Gourmet Lafayette supermarket is in the department store and there is a Monoprix with a supermarket in the basement behind the Printemps store next to the Galeries Lafayette. I had originally reserved a Deluxe room (185 Euros) with a queen bed which I had thought was a larger room. Upon checking in we discovered that these are small rooms with a wardrobe, desk, and a bathroom. I asked if one of the large rooms shown in their brochure and website was available. They only have two of these large rooms, one of which we were able to have for an additional 30 Euro/night. See the photos. These rooms on the first and second floors facing the street (which is very quiet there) have two twin beds pushed together, a desk and chair, couch, stuffed chair, coffee table, cabinet with mini bar and flat panel TV, wardrobe, , and with a much larger bathroom. There was free wireless internet in the room which provided unreliable connectivity in the evening when many seemed to be using it. There is also a computer in the lobby but if you want to print from this one you have to transfer you files to a USB key (they have one at the front desk to use) and print them at the front desk. There were only about 13 TV channels, which is typical for even 4-Star hotels that we have stayed at in Paris. They have CNN and Euronews (in French) plus the major TV channels as well as Eurosport, Arte, and TV5 Le Monde. The breakfast room is in the basement. The breakfast was excellent, the best we have had in Paris, especially for a 3-Star rated hotel. Not just a basket of rolls. There was two types of freshly baked cake, a flan, two types of meat, cheese, fruit, French bread, raisin and chocolate au pain, croissants, juice, coffee, tea, etc. All self-serve. The front desk staff are very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English when I tried to speak poor French. The only problem occurred on the Saturday morning we were there. The single elevator stopped working and they not going to able to get it fixed until Monday morning. Fortunately we were on the 2nd floor and they have two spiral staircases serving the 7 floors and the basement breakfast room. Overall we were very happy with the larger room that we were able to get. There was no way we could have spent 7 nights there in one of the "Deluxe" rooms. The 4-Star hotels that we have used in the past around the corner were considerably more expensive for a similarly sized room (275-400 Euro/night not including breakfast). The only other comment about this room was that I noticed a portable radiant heater on the window-side of the beds. The forced air heating and cooling system unit by the door didn't put out that much air in the large room even when the fan would infrequently run on high speed. So the portable heater provided some additional heat for the window-side of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Super Friendly Staff - Highly Recommend !!”
Reviews.Author: verypretty
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for work and decided to stay here. The location was perfect. It's less than 5 mins walk to metro and 7-8 min walk to St. Lazare station. The breakfast was great. Loved the fresh pastries every morning. The staff at the reception was very helpful and friendly. Especially Virgine. She was very sweet. I had to extend my stay and they extended it w/o any hassle. I have been to Paris several times but this one was one of my memorable stays. The local restaurants close by are very nice. Do try Chez Papa (French) and Pompeii if you feel like eating Italian food. These places are opened until late. I am surely staying here again. The rooms are very small but comfortable. I stayed here for almost 13 days.. I only have good things to say about this hotel . :).

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: tpn30
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem in more ways than one.I had the pleasure of staying there 6 times and each time I had nothing to complain about ! The staff at the reception go out of their ways to make you feel welcome and at ease, on top of being very professional. The size of the room is more than acceptable for Europe.The bathrooms have been renovated (new toilet/bathtub/sink/ ceramic). The bathtub is full size and deep enough for a long soak.Housekeeping keeps everything very clean, towels, bedsheets and the beds are in good condition. The breakfast buffet offers variety and fresh baked cakes/croissants/chocolatine everyday and the staff is always available to help. A computer is available in the lobby for guests and there is even free WiFi. Across the street you have a real bistro with excellent food at an affordable rate+ a small pâtisserie where u can get a homemade quiche . The location is perfect: galeries Lafayette, place de la Madeleine, l'Opéra (and much more) are at a walking distance, so it's very practical.Walking around at night I felt very safe .This is a place I would recommend to anyone, except to people who expect a 1200 square feet suite with personal butler :-) If you do choose this hotel, enjoy it .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Sightseeing in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rosepurdie
Reviews.Content: Hotel was well situated near Metro and sights of Paris. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, speaking English which was a big help with planning tours etc. Rooms were quite small but comfortable with free Wi-Fi. The Breakfast Room was lovely and all the food fresh and appetising, with lots of different choices to suit all tastes. Overall a well recommended hotel and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sierrakh
Reviews.Content: I ha ve stayed at the Folkestone two to three times a year the past approximately 8 years. I have been alone, with a girl friend, with my husband. The staff has been just wonderful, the breakfast is good choice, location is excellent with metro stops within one or two blocks, walkable to many tourist sites, lots of restaurants on the same street and some on several side streets in the area, haven't hit a bad one yet, Galleries Lafayette and Printemps about two blocks away, These people also own the Sydney and the Royal Opera (not a BW)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HHHYYY
Reviews.Content: 3-5 min walk from 2 metro stations, nice walk to many tourist attractions. Close to many shops and department stores. Hotel is small and room is tiny but it has all basics. Our room had terrace with table and chair so it was nice to have a drink or so. Room was very small no much space after we put 2 suitcases. But we are out most of the day so it was fine just for few days. Lift was broken for one night during our stay. It was horrible that we had to use stairs all the way up to 6th floor. All the hotel staff we saw was quite nice and friendly. All are multi-ligual. English off course. Hotel had free wi-fi and a PC that guests can use.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for seeing the sights, lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jan_UK08
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for our 3 night stay after it was recommended by a friend and we weren’t disappointed. It is perfectly located near public transport and the main attractions are within walking distance, 15-20 minutes to the Champs Elysees. The room itself could be described as cosy and the bathroom cosier too but they were both clean and very quiet. There is free internet available in the lobby or on wifi if you have a laptop or blackberry with you. We found the staff very welcoming and friendly and we were able to drop off our bags when we arrived early and head off to start sightseeing. We booked through the Best Western website and got a great rate of under £100 per night including breakfast which is unusual in Paris. The breakfast buffet was just what you would expect and there was plenty to go around. The only negative about the trip was the slightly temperamental lift but this was resolved in less than a day and didn’t cause any problems. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location, very clean, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Stryger
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend stay at this hotel, and we highly recommend this hotel. The staff was very friendly, the hotel is in an excelent location close to Opera Garnier / Madeleine Church / Galleries Lafayette. The hotel was very clean and nice. The bed was of a good size and breakfast was also very good. Room size is average. If you are an american you will find it small, but for european standards it is normal size. Plenty of restaurants in the area, try the one next to the theatre one street away (forgot the name of it)

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: ttmb
Reviews.Content: Stayed here four nights and was very satisfied. Yes, rooms are small and views not good, but breakfast was included and ample, along with free use of computer with wifi. Room clean and loved large, deep bathtub. The evening desk help was pretty useless and incompetent, but the main lady who worked it during the day was great and very helpful. Very close to metro and easy walking distance to sights. Felt safe the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: torontofashionsta
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. So centrally located that you could walk or take a short bus/metro around Paris. Even a late night taxi from Eiffel Tower was not bank breaking... Rooms were clean and well equipped. They could be considered small but we were not falling over each other and was actually a little bit larger than most rooms in Paris. We were greeted by a box of complimentary chocolate which i thought was a nice welcome. Water pressure which i am quite picky about was great and the bathrooms were very new with soft towels. Free Wifi worked great and fast on my laptop and my blackberry. Breakfast was included (not very usual for Paris) and was exactly what you want for breakfast in Paris. Croissants which were as good as any bakery, pain au chocolat, baguette, butter, jam, and of course coffee with hot milk! They had other things too like cereal and cold cuts but who would choose that over croissants? On the street you have a variety store, a little fruit place, and 2 bakeries that provide a great lunch option. Department stores are just around the corner so after a day of power shopping you only have a short walk with all your bags! Even at night walking in this neighbourhood was very safe. In short - I go to Paris once a year and have never found a hotel i wanted to return to. In this hotel category this is the best i have encountered. This could definitely become my yearly place and I can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with clean well-equipped rooms.”
Reviews.Author: 2009ad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 10 years ago and decided to return here, not least because of its excellent location. The room appeared to have been recently refurbished to its original high standard and was as spotlessly clean as last time. The bathroom was meticulously clean and well-lit. No cracks or chips here! The new beds were firm and the electric shutters provided very effective black-out and silence. The mini-bar was useful for storing some of our food purchases and the a/c was quiet and efficient. Take an electical adapter with you though, as the sockets in the room were not suitable for UK appliances -and there was no adapter available at reception. This meant we could not charge our mobiles and we had to buy another set of hair straighteners! The lift seems a bit temperamental. We were travelling in it one morning and the doors failed to open on two floors, and other guests said they'd had similar problems. Breakfast was nice, with plenty of choice, although sadly, it was not included in the price this time. In spite of booking online months in advance to take advantage of 'special internet rates' there was little difference between what we paid and the going rate. Galeries Lafayette (with a gourmet food hall!) was a stone's throw away, there were two 'Open' tour bus stops no more than a five-minute walk away. We strolled along the Champs Elysees one evening and it only took an hour to the Arc de Triomphe and back. A real plus was being able to leave our cases in a secure room free of charge the whole day after we checked out! Presumably you could do this if you arrived very early too! All in all, a very warm and welcoming hotel - we would stay there again with no hesitation.The pros far outweigh the cons!

Reviews.Title: “We definitely recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Victor-Rio
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 nights at this hotel (from May 29th to June 4th) and we liked very much. The hotel is clean and the location is perfect, we could walk to most of the attractions and there are six restaurants, two grocery shops and a bakery nearby. The hotel has an excellent buffet breakfast with pain du chocolat, baguettes, croissants, cheese, ham, yogurt, cereal, tea, coffee and orange juice. The staff speak English and if you need tickets for some attractions and shuttle to the airport, they book it for you. We will definitely stay again in this hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FunSightseeer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights at this hotel and had a great time in Paris. It was our first trip to Europe together and a colleague had recommended this hotel. The room was clean and the staff were super friendly and helpful. The location is ideal, we could walk to most of the attractions, and there were a wide variety of restaurants located by the hotel. The breakfast served at this hotel was fantastic! The cozy breakfast room was very quaint and the buffet was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all”
Reviews.Author: arbiter117
Reviews.Content: Rooms were microscopic even by European standards and you could easily hear the people in the next room talking,walking,showering and even worse! There was a huge hole in the ceiling that I was sure critters were going to scurry out of any minute. Our room was overlooking the alleyway and I could probably have reached across to the office building next door and made coffee for the workers staring into our room. Staff was extremely indifferent to my complaints. Can't believe I paid $230 per night, not worth $80 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel in fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Lilololo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in May for a romantic city break and had a very pleasant stay. The rooms are not huge but are perfectly big enough for most people's purposes. The bathroom was small but functional with a really good power shower and most importantly very clean! We did not have any view from our bedroom window as it looked straight onto another office building but I did not find this a problem as it meant that it was VERY quiet at night and we were not disturbed by any people or road noise. The breakfast in the morning was really good and there was always plenty to go round. The best thing about this hotel is the location - it is about 5-10 mins walk from the Place de Concord and we walked to all the important attractions straight from the hotel. There are also lots of nice restaurants near to the hotel meaning you don't have to go far at night for a good meal. We also had free wi-fi in our hotel room which we didn't expect and was really handy as we had our laptop with us! The only downside to this hotel was that the room was stupidly hot because they still had the winter heating on even though it was very mild. Because of this we had to keep the windows open all the time but it didn't ruin the stay for us. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great locaiton for travelling throughout Paris”
Reviews.Author: Frenchpope101
Reviews.Content: My father and I stayed recently at the Folkestone and thought it was great. We booked through the bestwestern site directly and the rate for prepaid was better than anything out there and included breakfast. We were on the street side and even then it was not too noisy. The rooms are small but I am not in Paris to hang around the rooms I am there to tour around! It is in a great location which has easy acess to the RER (which takes you to the suburbs or the CDG airport), numerous other Metro lines (which take you throughout Paris) and is in walking distance from Opera, the Grands Magasin, and down to the Champs Elysee and Place de la Concorde. Highly recommend it and the staff was very friendly and spoke English if needed. they have an internet terminal as well which was helpful and a group of French newspapers and the Herald Tribune every morning to read!

Reviews.Title: “Nice cozy hotel very well located”
Reviews.Author: ParisTravel2009
Reviews.Content: It's a nice hotel where I will stay again. The rooms are small but cozy, well furnished. The bathroom was small but very clean and I can’t say the dimension really bother us. The hotel is very well located near subway, restaurants and a lot of shops. Also the Gare St. Lazare is nearby and even Place de la Concorde it’s ten minutes away. In fact we walk from the hotel to Place de la Concorde, Champs Elysees, Arc de Triumph and Tour Eiffel. It was a long walk but feasible and very pleasant on a nice sunny day. The breakfast was included and it was good. Not a very large variety but more than enough to give us a good start in the morning. The internet in the lobby was also useful but we needed some times to wait a few minutes for other persons to finish. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only problem we had was that the elevator didn’t work a few days and the staff offered us the minibar contents for free to compensate. I will definitely stay again in this hotel on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent convenient location, nice and clean, helpful staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CrisGuh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Folkestone Opera and loved everything about it. The staff is amazing. The hotel is clean and the location perfect. It's around the corner from the metro st madaleine. Close to the Place st madeleine and you can walk to the Place de concorde and Champs Elysee. It's very convenient and easy to get around. The best was that the breakfast is free and you can just call frnt desk and have them bring it t you room. At no additonal charge. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel or the staff. The rooms are small but confortable and clean. My room even had a balcony with a little garden. Adorable! They staff at front desk spoke English and if you need tickets for some attractions and shuttle to the airport, they book it for you. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: isneverenough
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Europe and so far our experince with hotels in London and Stockholm had been fantastic. Our luck ran out at this BW. From the very first moment we had problems with the our check in, the lady at reception was rude and not helpful at all and this attitude remained until we checked out 5 days later. The ladies at the breakfast area were more interested in gossiping in the kitchen and eating the food rather than making sure the guests were looked after. If we ever asked for anything we were given the most agressive look and were made to feel as we were in their way. RUDE! RUDE! RUDE! The rooms were a joke , so small .

Reviews.Title: “Who needs the Metro this is in an Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: neil-in-black
Reviews.Content: Situated around the corner from Madeleine, it's perfectly walkable to the Seine, St Germaine, The Louvre & Musee d'Orsay. We found the discounted room rate excellent for an Hotel pretty much bang in the centre of Paris. The neighbourhood felt safe and welcoming with plenty of shops and restaurants nearby, although it is an expensive area of Paris. The hotel is on a quiet street so no traffic noise during our stay. I'm going to have to rethink my stereotypical view of Parisians because the receptionist was warm and welcoming and spoke perfect English. The hotel is well decorated, indeed one floor was being decorated whilst we were there. The bedrooms were indeed small, however, I've stayed in smaller rooms in London and Manhatten. Unless your gonna hold a party, the room is adequate. Bathroom was as small as it could be though. I think I've had a larger bathroom in a caravan. But it was well presented. Breakfast, which unusually was included in our rate, was a very good buffet. Cold meats, cheese, pastries, boiled egg, fruit, cereals. etc. We filled our boots to last us until well into the day. No it's not 5 star, but if your on a budget I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: maggs007
Reviews.Content: we found this hotel with the reviews on trip advisor, it was in great location, though the rooms were alittle small, but clean!!! staff were very friendly and breakfast was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Small Room”
Reviews.Author: kiwiinmtg
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 7am and had paid for early check-in knowing that having come off 24+ hours of travel we would be exhausted. I'm sorry to say that the surly woman on the reception desk told us that they could hold our luggage but that our room would not be ready til 2pm so go away and come back then. She didn't care when we explained that we had been up travelling for over 24 hours and just wanted sleep and effectively told us to go away. We came back at 2pm dragging our feet from exhaustion after now having been up for over 36 hours and took the tiny elevator up to our room on the first floor to find it was very small and poky and not what we had been sold at all for our honeymoon. We didn't get the upgrade we were promised either. On the upside they had good breakfasts and free internet, but it is annoying when one person hogs it for ages because there is only one computer. The rest of the staff seemed nice apart from the lady on the reception on the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bannerbabefrance
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night in this hotel but I'm looking forward to going back. The hotel is cosy and welcoming and the receptionist and staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was very nice and clean with a flat screen tv!. The ensuite bathroom was large and very clean. The only negative point about this hotel is that you can hear the guests in the next room (especially if they are talking loud until 4am!). The breakfast room is in the lower level of the hotel, it's a little small but the large delicious buffet makes up for it. The hotel is in an ideal location within walking distance to the main shopping area in Paris and there is a choice of restaurants close by. I will definitely go back to this hotel but I will bring my earplugs next time!

Reviews.Title: “5 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Rita900
Reviews.Content: Good Location, easy to get from CDG Airport and rail stations. Room 309 was very narrow but very clean. 2 Twin Beds together. Bed, pillows and sheets very comfortable. Noise was not a factor, very quiet in the halls and outside. Bathroom very serviceable. Repair to shower was done very quickly, Great to have the mini fridge and safe in your room. Was able to have a kettle for the room and also use of an iron and board. A couple of good little shops for wine, water, juice or just about what ever you need for your room. Great location for the subway, buses, restaurants, shops and touring. Front desk could be a bit more friendly, especially the weekend girl. The fellow in the evenings was very friendly and helpful. Cleaning staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was more than enough. Eggs, cereals, juices, cakes, breads, yogurts, cheeses, lunch meats, mixed fruit salad, fresh fruit and of course coffee and teas. The lady in charge of the breakfast area could smile abit, the breakfast staff were always friendly. Some changes would be nice because after 5 days it does get boring but being included with the room rate was nice and not having to go out to have a coffee was great. Another plus is the free internet. Overall a good hotel we would recommend to others and return to. P.S. Make sure you check your room rate and do this the day before leaving, we had used Best Western Gift Cards as payment and there was an error made. Thanks to the hotel owner it is now being resolved.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: razorjayne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and is very close to Metro station Madeline... Also in walking distance is Champs Elysees and Galaries Lafayette! The rooms are quite small which is common throughout Europe but it was clean and comfortable. It is so difficult to find anything that is reasonably priced in Paris but I would say this was fair. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful... The was free internet access... And the breakfast was also good!! I would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “not Best Western standards”
Reviews.Author: wildernessAshland_Or
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this Best Western hotel in Paris. I was disappointed as I expected somewhat more Best Western standards as in the US. In short the location was great, staff was fairly friendly for Europe but the room was very disappointingly small and the beds were very hard. I had to use extra blankets as cushions and never got a good nights sleep. The bathroom was small but very bright and nice, but you had to fight to get to the evevator when the maids were out as there was no room in the hallways. Breakfast room was nice and food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & a good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: edleo13
Reviews.Content: My wife & I spent 3 nights at the Best Western Folkestone Opera from August 21st through 24th, 2008. This was our 3rd trip to Paris together, however our first stay at the Folkestone Opera. Overall, we were very pleased with the Hotel. The Hotel represents itself as a 3 star and we would agree (I would even go as far as placing it at the very top end of this designation.). We selected the Hotel primarily for its location and what appeared to be (from the website) fairly up to date décor and it did not disappoint. Room: We paid 115 Euros per night for a standard room (#603). We were very fortunate upon arrival to receive one of the 4 rooms on the 6th floor that have a balcony (sure is a nice place to wind down after a full day of sightseeing). The room and bathroom were tiny by American standards but fairly average by Paris standards. Furnishings were in very good shape and up to date. I was impressed by the flat screen TV. All hotel guests have access to free wireless internet. Aside from the balcony, the room didn’t have much seating other than the bed and a small desk with chair. Another hotel guest pointed out that the rooms without balconies appear to be about 4-5 feet wider. We spent so little time in the room that size didn’t really matter to us. The bed was comfy and the electronic privacy shade on the window kept the room very dark and quiet at night. Amenities: The hotel offers a breakfast in the basement for roughly 15 Euros per day. We never tried it. There are too many inexpensive breakfast options near the hotel (i.e. pastry shop in Madeleine metro station). Our room did not include an iron & board, but the front desk was happy to provide it to my wife upon request. We found all of the front desk clerks to be both friendly and helpful (all spoke at least some English). At night, the Hotel offers a small bar in the lobby where there are a couple of seating areas for guests to relax and a computer where guests can use the internet for free. Transportation: The hotel is within a short walk of a bevy of metro and RER stops. Madeleine (exit Rue Tronchet, walk a block or so, and Rue Castellane will be on your left) is arguably the closest; however Auber (RER A), Havre Caumartin, & Haussmann Saint-Lazare (RER E) are also very close. Honestly, the Hotel is close enough to walk to a lot of the top tourist sites (i.e. Concorde, Tuileries Garden, Louvre, etc.) however we generally chose to use the metro wherever possible to save the wear & tear on our feet. Airport: We used the RER to go to/from the CDG. RER B runs to Gare du Nord where you can transfer to RER E (direction: Haussmann Saint-Lazare). Follow the exit signs to Rue du Havre, go right out the exit, and keep walking until you see Rue Castellane on your right. (Note that Rue du Havre becomes Rue Tronchet at Boulevard Haussmann) Neighborhood: The Hotel is arguably in the epicenter of Paris shopping. Les Galeries Lafayette and Printemps (major department stores) are within a 5 minute walk as are a plethora of specialty stores (including a GAP for those of you who just discovered that Paris is pretty cool year-round and you didn’t bother to pack any jeans). We always felt safe walking to/from the Hotel, even after dark and late at night. Food: The immediate area around the Hotel is fairly residential and isn’t exploding with cafes and other food options. There is a brasserie just down the street however it seemed like it closed very early each evening (i.e. 20:00). Galeries Lafayette has a great food hall with about 5-6 eateries, various specialty restaurants (including some not so special…McDonalds!), a self-serve café, and a reasonably priced supermarket (great for cheap bottled water and Coke!) Finding food near the Hotel was seldom an issue for us as we sightsee from sun up to sun down and often ate wherever we were at during lunch/dinnertime. Overall we were very pleased with this Hotel. The location is great, the room was nice, and we felt like we got good value for our money. If you need a comfortable, clean place to sleep and shower each day, this is perfect for you. If you spend a lot of time in the room and need your space, you might want to consider some other options. We would definitely return to the Folkestone Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot”
Reviews.Author: NickD73
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located, close to Madeleine metro, and an easy walk from the Opera Garnier which means you can get the Roissybus to and from CDG airport which is much cheaper than a taxi. The hotel is clean and reasonably modern. The room was small but not cramped (especially for Paris!), and the bathroom was good. The receptionist when we checked in was very helpful and spoke good english, although the receptionist on the other shift and check out could have been more helpful. Our rate didn't include breakfast however there are two boulangeries in the street, and Fauchon (google it) just around the corner near the Madeleine does awesome pastries and good (although a bit expensive) coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Definite choice for the next time”
Reviews.Author: Janis81
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel for 5 days in July/August 2007 and enjoyed the time a lot. First of all, the hotel took into account our special request and gave us a room with a balcony - excellent! I had sent an email to the BW-site and asked for it, also informing that we'll arrive late. The person in the front desk even knew our name when we arrived. Room was spacius enough, toilet/shower did the work. Breakfast was all we could hope for, from serials and bread to 3-4 different fruitcakes every morning, fruit salad etc... Friendly personnel over all! Although communication was quite difficult because French people don't speak English that much... Location was nice. We walked a lot, but the nearest subway stations are quite near also. It took a little bit of time to find the nearest supermarket (if you don't count the kiosks nearby). Btw. it's behind the department stores at Rue De Caumartin walking street. If we'll visit Paris again, this we'll be our choice within this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: 1Caramel1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Folkestone Opera for 4 nights and it was perfect for our needs. We wanted a room with 2 single beds, an ensuite bathroom, air conditioning, and a central location, and the Folkestone delivered. Knowing that rooms tend to be small in Europe, we were pleasantly surprised with the size of the room and of the bathroom. It was also nice to have a tub/shower instead of just a shower and a hair dryer. The room was very clean and was on a side street, (about one block from a subway station) which was very quiet considering we were downtown. Our room rate also included breakfast daily, which was not fantastic, but adequate. Although the variety was pretty good, our only complaints were that the coffee was the worst we'd had in France and the cakes were a bit dry. Location-wise, we were within walking distance to various subway stations, the Roissy bus that takes you to the airport, Printemps, l'Opéra, and many restaurants. As amateur foodies, we couldn't have picked a better location being within walking distance of Fauchon, Maille, and numerous other gourmet food and wine shops. Staff were very friendly at this hotel, with the ladies taking care of breakfast always saying hello, and the front desk staff helpful with any questions we had. Overall a great stay and I rated this above average due to the rate (130EUR/night inc breakfast), the room, the cleanliness, the location, and the staff. A solid 3-3+ star property in a city with umpteen options for standard accommodation. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous6
Reviews.Content: We had a very bad experience at this hotel and will never return. Upon check in we were informed our guaranteed non-smoking room was not available and we would have to take a smoking room. When I asked if the next night we could be moved to a non-smoking room I was told there was a room but we would have to pay more money for it. It was a horrible night as we could smell smoke through out the entire evening as well as hearing everything in the next room. One of us could only be standing up at a time as there was not enough room to move around. (And we are not big people, 6 feet and 5'5...average weight) We put a 'do not disturb' sign out on the door for our entire stay AND told the front desk we did not want service but housekeeping went in everyday. They charge a 50 Euro fee for the key to the safe, which is refundable, but we were concerned about how many other keys there were out there. The hotel is in a good location but that is the only good thing I can say about it. I wish we would have stayed elsewhere even if it cost more as this hotel, the staff (who were all not helpful and snotty if you asked for anything), were all terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but the room maids steal”
Reviews.Author: lesleyDartfordKentUK
Reviews.Content: I took my partener to paris for his 50th birthday. The hotels location was very good and one of the reasons I went for it. You also know that best Western hotels have certain standards. Yes the rooms were small, but I had read about that on trip adviser. When we arrived there was a box of loose chocolates 3/4 full in our room along with a bottle of champange ( ordered for us by a friend ). We did not eat any of the choclates until the last evening, the day of my parteners birthday. When i opened the box there were only 7 left in the box !!!!!! Also I left a hairclip next to the bed which I use to clip up my hair when taking a shower and blow drying my hair, that also disappeared. I did report all this to the receptionist when I came to pay and she did say they were going to look into it. I know they are only small things but, I am glad the room had a safe to put our valuables in, if you know what I mean. The breakfast was a typical continental style breakfast but served the purpose. The ladies who were working there seemed to spend most of their time standing around in the small kitchen talking and did not seem too interested in the guest coming in to have breakfast. Although some of them did seem to be helping them slves to the food as well. The reception staff were very good and very helpful and all seemed to speak very good english, which was very helpful at times. All in all we did have a good stay, thre road the hotelis in is quite at night and has some very good restaurants especially the one right next door to it.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gerard7654
Reviews.Content: Best western Folkstone Opera in Paris. If you want to stay in a shoebox size room, this hotel is perfect for you. We had a reservation for 10 nights but we left after one night because of the above conditions. The brochure and pictures are misleading

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: ranstern
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights. Location is great, 3 minutes walk to Madeleine Metro, 5 minutes walk from Opera, Galleries Lafayette and Roissybus. Rooms are OK, pretty small but that can be expected in this area. A/Cdid not work too well, and when we told the receptionist she said she would check, but nothing was done. Breakfast was also OK, but nothing special. The staff was pretty friendly, especially the girls who were there during the day. The one who was there for most of our stay would check the internet or make a phone-call to answer any question we had about a restaurant or a store. We stayed in room 201, which is right on the street, so we got a good smell of the next-door poultry shop every morning. What I found really irritating was their computer usage policy. They have wifi access for 3 Euro per 20 min, but the signal quality in the room is not that great. I was able to get a signal about as strong on a network called "radiolitec" and surf for a few minutes at a time for free. They also have a laptop on the bar you can use with the same rate (signal quality there is fine). I then wanted to connect my camera and burn a few photos to a cd. The laptop did not have a cd burner, so I tried their desktop computer, which they charge 7 Euro per 30 minutes to use, and couldn't connect my camera or burn to a cd. I also used that computer to check-in to my flight home via the web. While I was able to print out the web-generated boarding pass (B&W only), I was not able to send them to myself by email for reference. In short, their computer system sucks. Some more tips: 1. Book on the bestwestern webpage, they offer the best rates. 2. Book early. I could have saved a few 10s of Euros had I booked the hotel a few days earlier than I did (I booked over a week in advance).

Reviews.Title: “Great area, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katykaytravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in Paris at this hotel. The reviews were all pretty good so we took a chance. Hotel rooms in Paris are small but this room was Very Very small. The A/C didn't work properly and the girl at the desk didn't seem to care. The elevator is only big enough for two people and made bad noises. The staff overall was not very helpful. We asked in person for wake up calls two different times, never got one. The area is great. Close to shopping malls etc. This is a patisserie across the street and a small grocer just two doors down. I am going to Paris next year and I plan on staying in that area only in a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTravelbugs
Reviews.Content: We booked the "Folkestone Opera" on the good advice posted on this website and we were not disappointed. The staff was very friendly, the rooms are small, but we made a last minute request for a balcony and we were lucky to get one, because the hotel has only four rooms with balcony. We enjoyed having our breakfast and afternoon coffee there - weather permitting. The breakfast was very good, but repetitive, when you stay for more than a few days (we stayed for 2 weeks). The location of the Folkestone is very convenient to get to most major tourist sites (Louvre, Arc de Triomphe, Opera de Paris Garnier, etc.) We found it convenient to get a 2 day pass for the hop on - hop off Batobus, the river-boat shuttle service. It took us to the Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame, Jardin des Plantes, plus 5 other stops on the Seine. Food in the area is hit and miss. We had a great French Restaurant "Le Madeleine C." next to the hotel. The food, wine and service were just excellent. We also had some good Lasagna at "Pizza Pompei", which is at the west end of the rue Castellane. Avoid the "Cafe Relais Tronchet" on the rue Tronchet . Bad food (lousy French Onion Soup) and bad service. At the two bakeries on rue Castellane we had cake that was not fresh, but we can recommend the bakery "Paul" at the corner of rue Tronchet and Blvd. Haussman. One recommendation : get a good map of Paris before your trip, with a good index - the road system is confusing, as street names change between major intersections. Enjoy your time at the Folkestone!

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate - wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: RomiM
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our visit to Paris. My partner wanted a Best Western property and we booked via BW's website solely based on reviews from TripAdvisor. We are glad we did! The hotel was spotless and looks newly and totally renovated. The entire staff was friendly and wonderful, especially Virginie and Anais at the front desk. Our room was on the fourth floor, facing the back, and was very quiet, but tiny (as was the elevator). We stored some of our luggage on top of the tall and narrow closet to save space (careful as it's a bit dusty up there). The air conditioning worked well and there were big windows that opened fully for fresh air. We asked and received upon check-in a coffee making set - kettle, coffee, tea etc. The room and bathroom were spotless. Toiletries and the comfortable towels were replaced daily. The beds were very comfortable as well - important after walking for hours and hours! Two minor complaints - the mini bar didn't really cool well. On the second day we brought some ice up and put it in with some food we bought which helped. Second, I would have liked stronger water pressure in the shower but that issue didn't bother my partner. Breakfast was wonderful. The room is decorated very nicely - yes it was basement level but it didn't matter a bit. It was clean and well lit as well. The food was great and there was a large selection. The croissants were out of this world in my opinion, as was a sponge type cake as well that I loved. Along with the many pastries and cakes served there were also baguettes, cereal, fruit cocktail, ham, cheeses, granola, cornflakes, jams, honey, butter, juices, yogurts and hard boiled eggs. Internet use was pricey (7 euro for 1/2 hour) so we didn't use it but I was glad to have the option. We are two women and we felt safe in the area, and it is in walking distance (if you want) to the Champs Elysees. Haussman and Tronchet streets for shopping are right there. The famous Fauchon gourmet food store is at the Madeleine square (go in for a look!). There are two metro stations nearby as well, along with cafes and restaurants. The Roissy bus (to/from Charles de Gaulle airport) is about a 10 minute walk away. If I may sum up, the location is great. There is no luggage room but you can leave your luggage across from the check-in desk after checking out if you want. All in all we were very happy with our experience and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “exactly what we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: Skamom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 2 adult sons just returned from a 5 night stay at the Folkestone Opera. I was a little apprehensive, but I trusted the reviews on Trip Advisor! We were not disappointed! Even though the rooms are small by American standards, they were fine for us. The rooms were very clean and cheery. The location was excellent-near everything and in a nice, safe neighborhood. We ate breakfast every morning at the hotel-this was included in our price of 150 Euros per night, per room.(I booked through the Best Western site) There was always plenty to eat and we saved a lot of money by eating at the hotel. The staff was always friendly and helpful when we had questions. This hotel is in the area of Madeleine-near shopping, metro, restaurants--everything! We would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel! A great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the BW Folkestone Opera !!!”
Reviews.Author: FRQTFLYR
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the BW Folkestone Opera for 5 nights at the end of March, beginning of April 2007. I searched the BW website through numerous properties in Paris and finally decided on this particular hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. I must admit, I was very pleasantly surprised with the hotel and our experience there. The Best Western Folkestone Opera is a wonderful hotel for the price we paid which was 114 Euros/night for a double room, including breakfast. I booked it directly through the BW hotel website. The hotel is in a great location, right around the corner from the Metro Station Madeleine and very close to other metro stations as well. The hotel is located on a quite side street off of La Rue Tronchet which is a bussling street with many stores, shops, brasseries, and cafes. On the same street as the hotel are a few great restuarants...a Thai restaurant, an Italian place and a few others. There were also a few small market stores where you could buy fresh fruit, water, juices and snacks to have on hand in your hotel room at night. Across the street is a great Patisserie where they had fresh pastries and baguettes everyday. The front desk staff was very friendly and very helpful when I checked in. Check in was very quick and smooth without any problems. The elevator to our 4th floor room was a bit small, but this is quite normal in Europe. There is a lounge in the lobby where you can have cocktails anytime, there is also a sitting area and a computer for internet access. Our room #403 was great. It was very very clean, cozy and very comfortable. Again, rooms in Europe are usually small so this was what I expected. The bathroom was extremely clean as well as the shower facilities. The shower was a good size, the normal by Canadian/USA standards. The shower head itself was a handheld but you were able to have it on the wall so you could shower without having to hold it. I've been in other hotels where this was not the case and you'd have to hold the shower in one hand and clean with your other hand. Our room overlooked la Rue Castellan where the hotel is on and it was very quite. The windows could open so you were able to get fresh air into the room and at night, there were automatic shutters...all at the press of a button. We had a double bed...which was a real double bed, and not 2 singles stuck together like other hotels in Paris do. Breakfast was served every morning in the breakfast room in the basement. It was amazing, very clean, quaint and a large selection of foods....different breads, pastries, croissants, cheese, hams, eggs, juices, coffee, tea, yogurt, cereals, fruits. The ladies working in the breakfast room were very nice, you got to know them after your first morning there. The location of the hotel itself is in a quiet and safe area. We would return each evening very late and to be greeted warmly by the front desk person. Everyone spoke perfect English and everyone was very helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris. I will definitely stay there again. I'm glad I read the reviews on here first before booking this hotel. I'm looking forward to my return to Paris and the BW Folkestone Opera.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked it.”
Reviews.Author: lisaobear
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel because of the location, so convenient to everything. The room was small, but who cares when you're in Paris? The breakfast was so good, and the ladies who prepared it were so friendly and nice. Virginie at the front desk was very helpful when we needed to get information concerning our flight home....we really appreciated it.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient”
Reviews.Author: pafuri
Reviews.Content: Very near- a block from the nearest metro- and only a couple from the 2 huge deaprtment stores, Printemps and Lafayette, this hotel is very convenient. Nearby there is a bakery, convenience store,l and at least 10 restaurants within walking distance. Breakfast, which is included in the price is great- large choice including 2 or 3 cakes, bread, pastries, croissants, juices, fruit, cheese, ham and boiled eggs. The only downside is the size of the rooms, which are tiny. We had 3 seperate rooms and all were small. But then you're not in the room a lot in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Shorek
Reviews.Content: I spent three days at the Folkestone Opera and i've found everything perfect. The location is fantastic, just a few steps from place de la madleine, in one of the finest arrondisment of paris. The room was comfortable, clean and not so small (i gave a look at the plant of the floor, i've to say that we were lucky: our room -502- was the biggest of the floor). Staff is friendly and spoke a perfect english.. I loved this hotel, and you will too.

Reviews.Title: “excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: iloveeuropetoomuch
Reviews.Content: great hotel. big room. not too expensive. nice location but next time would stay in latin quarter as there is more action and night life there. this hotel is in a good location however is pretty quiet. close to concord, louvre. great breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Pit_Schnass
Reviews.Content: The Folkestone is a basic 3 star hotel in a good location. The rooms are small, clean, comfortable and quiet at night . But that's about it. The staff is effecient but not exceptional friendly (they hardly look up when you enter the hotel). At breakfast there is almost no service. You have to pick up a tray and look for an empty table. After breakfast (french standard) you are supposed to clear the table yourself. It's a good hotel but don't excpect anything special. It's definetly not a "gem" or the "best hotel in Paris" like written here before.

Reviews.Title: “a good choive”
Reviews.Author: phil5
Reviews.Content: among the hundreds of 3 stars hotels in paris this one is a good choice. stayed several times and i give you the pluses and minuses (compared to others in the same category) very good loacation for sightseeing specially for a first stay in Paris very quiet street fully renovated and clean. near a convenient (roissy airport line) and not to complex metro station very efficient ACsystem if you stay in summer good complimentary breakfast No need to reserve monthes in advance to get a room as in the "saint germain - notre dame" area TIPS the rooms with large balcony are the number 601 and 603 but there are small rooms in 01 (101, 201,...) are close to the lift and really noisy but there are among the biggest... rooms in 01, 03, 05 are located on the street but itis not a concern as the street is very quiet minuses the breakfast policy is not very clear , use the best western web site the complimentary status will be clearly confirmed, average price is around 100 euros . the area is residential and is not very lively at night

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL LITTLE GEM IN THE HEART OF BEAUTIFUL PARIS!”
Reviews.Author: WillyFogg
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Best Western Hotel Folkstone in May for 2 nights. We had emailed the very pleasant receptionist a few days prior to our stay to request a room with a balcony, we were politely informed that they could not guarantee this but would do everything they could to arrange this for us. Sure enough, on our arrival the receptionist told us 'there was a little surprise outside the room' - they had indeed arranged a balcony room for us on the top floor. The room was lovely, small but certainly more than adequate, with lovely beams and modern decor. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was small but very clean with a powerful shower. The balcony was a delight, it overlooked the quiet street and was perfect for morning coffee or a pre-dinner drink! It was very spacious too. The hotel itself is very clean and the staff are very friendly, which is an added bonus in Paris! Despite the central location of this hotel, it was very quiet. The breakfast was delicious, with a generous range of meat, cheese, fruit, yoghurt and pastries. The breakfast room itself was charming, with stone walls and clean, tiled flooring. We had an absolutely lovely time at the Hotel Folkestone, whilst it does not have the luxury of a 5* hotel, it is quintessentially Parisian and captures the real atmosphere of the city. It is in an excellent location, near the Avenue Des Champs Elysee as well as the wonderful Gallerie Layfattes. A stroll along Rue du Rivoli takes you to the Louvre with many boutique style shops along the way. We will definitely be returning to Paris and the lovely Hotel Folkestone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dorset2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in July. This was a present from my husband for my birthday, it was brilliant. The room was very clean, the air conditioning was fantastic. The temperature outside was 35 degree's, the temperature inside was 15! wonderful. The breakfast was excellent, everything fresh, the cakes were all home made. The breakfast room was in the basement, but was very light and welcoming. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. As previous reviews have commented there are some lovely restaurants to the left as you go out of the hotel, and also 2 little shops that sell everything. The fruit was delicious, they sold enormous cherries which were so sweet. We went on several tours, which could all be arranged by the hotels, and would heaartily recommend tours by euroscope, they collect and return you to your hotel in air conditioned minibuses.

Reviews.Title: “unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: dedicated-doctor
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris on July 8. Our family is composed of 2 adults and 3 children, aged 10, 8 and 4 years. We had made a reservation for 2 rooms and everything was OK. We stayed initally for 3 nights, then left for Disneyland for another 3 nights. Before leaving the hotel, we reconfirmed our return on July 14 ( holiday) . We arrive at the Folkestone at 11 pm on July 14, only to be told that we have to take a 3rd room, since we are not allowed to have a 4 year old child with an adult and another child in the room!!! The supervisor was quite inflexible and next day we had to leave the hotel and look for something else, dragging 3 children and the luggage around. The girl at the front desk found another hotel that would have costed us 270 euro at night.!, so we had to shop around. Another piece of information one should know is that we were having our country ( Lebanon) bombed, with air, sea and land blockade , we did not know WHEN and HOW we were to go back and for how long we were to stay in France. This was explained to the administration to no avail!!!! We could not believe it, could not understand the logic of it, especially since we stayed there 3 days earlier, and at no time we were told there were any problems. So I think this treatment was not only unacceptable, but inconsiderate of the circumstances and of the stress we were in. It was inhumane and illogical. ( other than the fact that the rooms were very small, one room 503 had a bathroom so small that one's knees were hitting the wall while sitting on the toilet and the breakfast room in the basement was so hot that you could barely stay for 10 minutes to eat while sweating)

Reviews.Title: “Just as Expected”
Reviews.Author: Traveling Fool 2
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Trip Advisor, I had researched fairly extensively the moderate-priced hotels in Paris. The B/W Folkestone Opera was precisely what we expected, as a result...a clean, safe hotel in a good area of Paris. This hotel was easily accessible by Metro, and the evening staff was most helpful in assisting with calling cabs for the next morning or making recommendations to us. The highlight was the complimentary breakfast. The breads were incredible, the cheese and ham delectable. The bathrooms were immaculate, the amenities what we would expect back in the USA, and the room size was of little concern to us since we expect this in Europe. We found the lobby computer to be fast and easy to use with the prepaid card. (The French keyboard, however, is another matter!) It was a perfect situation, and we are so glad we stayed there! We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “clean gem; location location location”
Reviews.Author: meskean
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this small hotel. They were very accomodating when a relative wanted to come along and they were fully booked- so they arranged her stay in the next door Opera Royal hotel (which seemed to be very clean as well but didn't have A/C). The rooms & bathrooms are as usual in Paris small; but tiptop clean; airconditioned, and I enjoyed the geraniums on the outside of my window. However the best thing about this hotel is its location - it is not on a boulevard, so there is less noise from the street. There is a bakery accross the street, some restaurants and small food stores are located in the street if you don't feel like walking anymore after a long day visiting the city. It is so near the Madeleine metrostop; and the bus stops off rue Tronchet. Place de la Concorde and all the grands magasins are within a few mins walking.

Reviews.Title: “Folkestone is a Great Place To Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: TucsonAmeriCanadian
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 9 night stay at this hotel. The company my husband works for had booked us in at a hotel closer to Champs Elysee, but having read terrible reviews about the hotel we were booked at, I insisted we stay somewhere else. So, booked this hotel based on the above reviews, and I must say we were not disappointed whatsoever. Yes, small rooms....but other than the garbage pick-up every morning, it was very quiet. Probably the cleanest hotel rooms we have ever stayed in....spotless.....great linens. Very enjoyable breakfast (croissants were "to die for"-- don't let their appearance fool you!) Wonderful location....we walked almost everywhere.....short walk to shopping, Louvre, Orsay, longer walk to Eiffel tower, and Notre Dame, but still walkable, if you're used to it. Don't shy away from the metro-- it's very handy from this hotel, and be sure and purchase the one day pass to Versaille which includes your train cost. We would stay here again in a heartbeat, .... and probably will. For best rates....book through the Best Western Website!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryland2010
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our stay at the BW Folkstone Opera Hotel in Paris, and it was terrific. The hotel lived up to our expectations based on previous reviews...clean, very-well located, nice sized rooms, and helpful staff. We can definitely recommend it to any one visiting Paris. We booked using the Best Western website and got a great rate that included a very good breakfast. The hotel is near many of the big tourist sites, and there are two Metro lines within very close walking distance. Also, lots of shopping at Au Printemps and other stores. We ate at two nearby restaurants, and can recommend both (Chez Papa is right around the corner and L'Entreacte is near the Opera itself).

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Hotel Folkestone Opera
